summary: This is an internal email from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, dated August 9, 2019, listing findings from daily fire and security checks. It reports multiple operational failures and missing accountability forms, including missing handcuffs, a broken cell sink, and inoperable equipment. The document is significant as it provides a snapshot of security conditions at the facility shortly before Jeffrey Epstein's death.

events.title: Missing Accountability Forms
events.description: Multiple daily accountability forms were reported missing, including knife and tool accountability, key count, daily roster, and attorney inventory forms.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is dated August 9, 2019, just days before Jeffrey Epstein's death on August 10, 2019.
It reports multiple security failures at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, including inoperable equipment and missing accountability forms.
Specific issues include a broken sink in Cell 4, inoperable doors, missing handcuffs, and an inoperable X-ray machine.
Missing forms from August 6, 2019, include knife and tool accountability, key counts, daily rosters, and attorney inventory.
The document suggests potential lapses in security protocols and record-keeping at the facility where Epstein was held.
